main event: An unidentified flying object (UFO) sighting occurred at Robins Air Force Base, Georgia on 23rd September 1952 at around 2200 hours. The sighting involved multiple white lights in the sky, and the objects were observed to move at a uniform speed and maintain a steady light.
interesting points: The sighting involved 9-15 objects described as big and bright lights in the sky, each about the size of a foot and brighter than the moon.
The objects were silently illuminated with bright red color, hovering at an estimated distance of about five miles and an altitude of 12,000 feet or more.
Witnesses observed a disc-shaped object with white lights above the rim, making distinct turns and hovering for approximately two minutes before moving away.
No sound, vibration, smoke, or other peculiarities were detected, but a luminous, rotating tail was observed trailing from the object.
The sighting was reported from 34-32Z to 34237 on 24th September 1952 and was seen for as long as 20 minutes by different observers.
sighted object: multiple white lights in the sky, a disc-shaped object with white lights above the rim
witnesses: credited military personnel and base personnel
